definition: to invert right and wrong
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
is/are/am/yes/to be
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: We use it to describe someone who confuses right and wrong deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 我們用它來形容那些故意顛倒是非的人。

sentences.english: No matter how unfair or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 不管有多麼不公平或是顛倒是非。

sentences.english: This act of confusing right and wrong can not be accepted by the Chinese side.
sentences.chinese: 這種顛倒是非的做法是中方所不能接受的。

sentences.english: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
sentences.chinese: 真的，神必不作惡，全能者也必不顛倒是非。

sentences.english: All these indicate the wild ambition of Japanese Fascist militarism arid the confusion of right and wrong.
sentences.chinese: 這些足見日本法西斯軍國主義的狼子野心和顛倒是非。

definition: to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
obscene language
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
extremism
disorder
to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
specious arguments/sophistry
to have no sense of shame/brazen
misconception/fallacy
presumption of innocence (law)
power struggle
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
(political) party platform/party program
